Class Bank

  • java.lang.Object
    • Bank

  • public class Bank
extends java.lang.Object
    This class simulates a bank, which is essentially a collection of bank accounts.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private BankAccount[] accounts
      Array of accounts in the bank.
      (package private) static int MAX_ACCOUNTS
      Maximum number of accounts a bank can have.
      private java.lang.String name
      Name of the bank.
      private int no_of_accounts
      Current number of accounts in the bank.

      Constructor for Bank.

      Method to add an account to the bank using the appropriate BankAccount constructor.

      Method to add an account to the bank using the appropriate BankAccount constructor.

      Method to add an account to the bank using the appropriate BankAccount constructor.

      Return the number of accounts in the bank.

    • Field Detail

      • name

        private java.lang.String name
        Name of the bank.

      • accounts

        private BankAccount[] accounts
        Array of accounts in the bank.

      • no_of_accounts

        private int no_of_accounts
        Current number of accounts in the bank.

      • MAX_ACCOUNTS

        static final int MAX_ACCOUNTS
        Maximum number of accounts a bank can have. This value is 15.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Bank

        public Bank(java.lang.String name)
        Constructor for Bank. Initialize the instance variables.
        Parameters:
        name - String representing the name of the bank

    • Method Detail

      • createAccount

        public int createAccount()
        Method to add an account to the bank using the appropriate BankAccount constructor. If it is not possible to do so, return 0. Else, create a new account with account number x if this is the x'th account in the bank, and return 1.
        Returns:
        integer that is 1 if the account is created successfully and 0 otherwise

      • createAccount

        public int createAccount(double balance)
        Method to add an account to the bank using the appropriate BankAccount constructor. If it is not possible to do so, return 0. Else, create a new account with account number x if this is the x'th account in the bank. Initialize the balance and return 1.
        Parameters:
        balance - double representing the balance in the newly created account (in addition to MIN_BALANCE)
        Returns:
        integer that is 1 if the account is created successfully and 0 otherwise

      • createAccount

        public int createAccount(java.lang.String email)
        Method to add an account to the bank using the appropriate BankAccount constructor. If it is not possible to do so, return 0. Else, create a new account with account number x if this is the x'th account in the bank. Initialize the customer's name and return 1.
        Parameters:
        email - String representing the customer's email id
        Returns:
        integer that is 1 if the account is created successfully and 0 otherwise

      • createAccount

        public int createAccount(java.lang.String email,
                         double balance)
        Method to add an account to the bank using the appropriate BankAccount constructor. If it is not possible to do so, return 0. Else, create a new account with account number x if this is the x'th account in the bank. Initialize the customer's name and balance and return 1.
        Parameters:
        email - String representing the customer's email id
        balance - double representing the balance in the newly created account (in addition to MIN_BALANCE)
        Returns:
        integer that is 1 if the account is created successfully and 0 otherwise

      • getNoAccounts

        public int getNoAccounts()
        Return the number of accounts in the bank.
        Returns:
        integer representing the number of accounts in the bank

      • transaction

        public int transaction(BankAccount b1,
                       BankAccount b2,
                       double amount)
        Perform a transaction between two bank accounts. If the amount is negative, return -1. If it is possible to perform the transaction, return 1. Else return 0;
        Parameters:
        b1 - BankAccount object corresponding to the account from which the amount is transferred
        b2 - BankAccount object corresponding to the account to which the amount is transferred
        amount - double representing the amount to be transferred
        Returns:
        -1 if the amount is negative, 1 if the transaction is successful and 0 otherwise
